page.title: 08A Ladock Valley Dairy Farm.
page.content: Phillip Smith farms at{Fenton Ladock. His father bought the farm 32 years ago. It has{178 acres}and is a dairy farm. There is a herd of{80 Freisan cows which are milked in a {herring-bone parlour}installed three years ago. The cows produced{400,000 {gallons of milk}last year owing to a reduction of the E.E.C. quota yields. Mr. Smith has{80 bullocks, 40 calves and a{Hereford bull.}50 of the cows are artificially inseminated by Freisan bulls, the heifers and the rest of the cows are served by the Hereford bull. The cows eat{grass}in the summer. In the winter they stay in the yard; they eat{silage}and some {hay.}They are fed a mixture of{corn and{protein concentrates}in the parlour. Mr. Smith grows the corn himself. This year he has{45 acres of {spring barley.
